class.name: Joint3D
class.description: Joints are used to bind together two physics bodies. They have a solver priority and can define if the bodies of the two attached nodes should be able to collide with each other. See also [Generic6DOFJoint3D].

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the [PhysicsBody3D]s assigned to [member node_a] and [member node_b] will collide with each other.
The first [PhysicsBody3D] attached to the joint.
The second [PhysicsBody3D] attached to the joint.
The priority used to define which solver is executed first for multiple joints. The lower the value, the higher the priority.
